description: {"blocks":[{"key":"erfdf","text":"Protocol developed by the Culver Lab at the University of Arizona to extract DNA from feces for depositor species identification","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dpr77","text":"Saturate cotton-tipped applicators with PBS buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"30ig3","text":"● Keep cotton-tipped applicators in PBS buffer for at least 3 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"br556","text":"Pipette 25 μl of proteinase K and 300 μl of ATL buffer (from DNeasy kit) into a new, labeled 2 ml microcentrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6fvvl","text":"Place a sheet of copy paper on a stainless-steel tray to analyze scat samples for swabbing. Swab the surface of the scat with PBS-saturated applicator. Cut the applicator tip and place it in the 2 ml microcentrifuge tube from step 2.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"al58r","text":"●  Bleach and dry the tray and change the copy paper after each sample is processed. ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9t4v6","text":"●  Change gloves after each scat sample is processed.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36ic","text":"●  Scissors used to cut the applicator should be submerged in 10% bleach, rinsed, and wiped dry before cutting the next applicator.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"164k2","text":"Incubate samples at 56°C for 24 – 48 hours.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ftj4","text":"● To reduce the risk of evaporation due to faulty caps, cover the cap of tubes with parafilm.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dffof","text":"Remove parafilm and spin tubes for 15 seconds to remove condensation inside the tube lids.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"df6cv","text":"Remove the applicator and add 366 μl of AL buffer. Vortex and incubate at 56°C for 1 hour.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"q7jo","text":"●  Scissors or tweezers used to remove the applicator should be submerged in 10% bleach, rinsed, and wiped dry before removing the next applicator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c53n3","text":"Add 366 μl of 100% ethanol and mix by inverting. Continue to step 8 or store at 4°C (stable for weeks).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2r7t","text":"Label spin columns provided by Qiagen kit and carefully apply 500 μl of lysate from step 7 to the column without moistening the rim.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"agvpm","text":"Centrifuge according to Qiagen DNeasy protocol \u003e= 6000 x g (8000 rpm) for 1 min.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8hcgn","text":"Place the columns in a new 2 ml collection tube, and discard the tube containing the filtrate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ebv2","text":"Carefully open the column, apply a second aliquot of 500 μl of lysate and centrifuge according to Qiagen DNeasy protocol \u003e= 6000 x g (8000 rpm) for 1 min.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"emvr0","text":"Place the columns in a new 2 ml collection tube and discard the tube containing the filtrate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2qi10","text":"Prepare AE buffer: Bring Buffer AE to 70°C with the heat block. Pipette 100 ul (or 200 for less concentrated DNA) of buffer AE per sample into a new tube and place it in heat block (To use at the end)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"furhg","text":"Add 500 μl of AW1 wash buffer to column. Centrifuge at \u003e= 6000 x g (8000 rpm) for 1 min. Place the column in a new 2 ml collection tube. Discard the tube containing the filtrate.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":14,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d95bo","text":"Add 500 μl of AW2 wash buffer to column. Centrifuge at 20,000 x g (14,000 rpm) for 3 min. Place the column in a new 2 ml collection tube. Discard the tube containing the filtrate.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":14,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"82lsl","text":"Place the columns in a new 2 ml collection tube. Centrifuge at 20,000 x g (14,000 rpm) for 1 min. (Dry spin: this step helps to eliminate the chance of possible buffer AW2 carryover). Discard the tube containing the filtrate.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dsjmd","text":"Remove the column and place it into a labeled 1.5 ml tube. Cut off the caps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ighj","text":"Add 100 - 200  μl of AE elution buffer directly to the column and incubate at room temperature for 1 to 3 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92s0t","text":"● Elution with 100 µl (instead of 200 µl) increases the final DNA concentration in the eluate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"783hq","text":"Centrifuge columns at ≥ 6000 x g (8000 rpm) for 1 minute to elute DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9hekj","text":"Transfer DNA into labeled 0.5 ml or 1.5 ml tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f3j39","text":"Discard columns and store DNA at 4°C or -20°C for long term.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"661o1","text":"Disinfect countertops and equipment with 10% bleach solution.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3s35e","text":"Qiagen Kit: Qiagen DNeasy Blood and Tissue extraction Mini kit ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5q1jk","text":"Lab Equipment: Heat block, Vortex, Centrifuge, Pipettes, Stainless steel tray, Stainless steel Scissors, Stainless steel tweezers","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7uvi","text":"Solutions and Reagents: 10x PBS (to make 1000 ml of 10X PBS: 5.56 g NaH2PO4, 23.0 g NaHPO4, 87.68 g NaCl, pH to 7.1), proteinase K, ATL buffer, AL buffer, AW1 buffer, AW2 buffer, AE buffer (provided by Qiagen kit), 100% ethanol 100% (not provided)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55rbt","text":"Consumables: 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tubes, 2 ml microcentrifuge tubes, 2 ml collection tubes, 100-1000 μl pipette tips (filter and sterile), 10-100 μl pipette tips (filter and sterile), QIAamp spin columns (provided by Qiagen kit), sterile cotton-tipped applicators ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fajf","text":"Other supplies: Parafilm, copy paper, paper towels,10% bleach solution, gloves","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ok5v","text":"Check Qiagen manual \"Things to do before starting\"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2lpif","text":"Optional:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f9aeq","text":"For maximum DNA yield, repeat elution once as described in steps 19-21 . This step leads to increased overall DNA yield. A new microcentrifuge tube can be used for the second elution step to prevent dilution of the first eluate. Alternatively, to combine the eluates, the microcentrifuge tube from step 7 can be reused for the second elution step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: DNA Extraction from Swabbed Feces for Depositor Species Identification - 2024
